alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 3:23PM MDT until August 01 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Jefferson County in central Colorado... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 323 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Buffalo Creek. 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported roads impassible near Buffalo Creek. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Buffalo Creek, Pine Grove, Wellington Lake, Pine Junction, Conifer, South Platte, Aspen Park, Foxton and Shaffers Crossing. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
